884628597:
[

Master Scheduler

Company Name UniSuper Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 9 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

UniSuper’s Program Management Business Unit is progressing to the next phase of building project management capability with the organisation. A number of key areas for improvement have been identified including the uplift of capability, increased accuracy of data integrity and to gain clearer insights to support execution of strategies across the ePMO.



About Us

UniSuper is one of Australia’s largest superannuation funds, and is run solely for the benefit of its members. For more than 34 years, UniSuper has been managing super for people employed in the higher education and research sector. UniSuper currently invests around $66 billion on behalf of 400,000 current and former higher education and research employees.

UniSuper is facing many of the challenges other businesses face in this digitally driven, changing world that we work in. We have a purpose to support our higher education sector members in assisting them with future retirement goals and a focus on enabling them to have a seamless experience when they engage with us.

About The Role

As a part of the Program Management team, this role will take a real lead in shaping the new way we think, operate and enable our business teams.

This role is for an initial 6 month period, however there is a high chance of extension given the workload.

This is an all-encompassing Master Scheduler role, with a wide range of responsibilities including:
  • Uplifting and improving, integrating and maintaining a master schedule across multiple programs and projects with a strong focus on do-ability
  • Identifying critical paths, dependencies, risks, major milestones, do-ability, decision points within project lifecycles and other project events
  • Providing analysis and insights into the schedule that enables clear decision making
  • Embedding and providing guidance, support on new PMO standards and processes across the portfolio
  • Working closely with projects, to ensure PMO standards and practices are being effectively implemented at the required quality standard.
  • Analysing project and portfolio performance to provide insights on lead and lag indicators that influence and inform management decisions
  • Establishing knowledge management processes and portfolio improvement initiatives, and facilitating process and capability improvements across the portfolio

About You

You will present with a wealth of scheduling experience within a project environment; whilst having a real sense of the entire end-to-end supply chain and how plans can quickly change. We are looking for this person to have the ability to create impactful and meaningful portfolio reports that provide clear executive insights and allow efficient and accurate decision making.

You will have be able to apply a real agile approach by learning and rapidly evolve your approach to match the project execution methods and needs, and have a real ability to build relationships, create trust and transparency with an ability to engage and influence stakeholders at all levels.

You will have a deep knowledge of business analysis and experience in project management and demonstrated ability to provide oversight of large transformational projects and portfolio of change, and be able to flex with the fast paced nature of an ePMO environment.

What We Offer You

At UniSuper, we offer competitive salaries, flexible and diverse working environments, and have modern offices in the heart of the CBD.

We also offer a range of paid volunteer days to support charities, discounted gym membership schemes, seated massages and discounted movie tickets.

When you also include an additional 3 days paid leave over the Christmas and New Year period and a chance to work with a great team of people, we feel we have great environment.

If you feel you have the experience and skills required for this role, please apply!


Please note: Successful applicants will be required to complete a Police Check prior to commencement of employment, and all job offers are subject to completion of satisfactory reference checks.

Reporting to the Branch Manager of ACT, the Territory Manager will take full ownership of servicing existing accounts and developing the company’s business potential within the Canberra and surrounding regions.

884647346:
[

Casual Teacher - EAL, AMEP (Foundation College)

Company Name Chisholm Institute Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 19 hours ago Number of views 2 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Expressions of Interest 2018
  • Hourly Rate : $65.01 / $67.57 per hour
  • Foundation College


About Us

Chisholm is Victoria’s premier public vocational education and training provider, with campuses located across Melbourne and the south east.

Each year, we welcome some 30,000 students from over 43 culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds. More than 1,200 passionate and dedicated Chisholm employees work together to deliver quality training and education in Melbourne’s south east manufacturing heartland and key residential growth corridor.

A Victorian Government-owned TAFE, we aim to lead the way in education and training to inspire success and transform lives.

Our purpose is to excel in education and training and be respected and valued for enhancing the social and economic futures of individuals, industry and communities.

Our drive for commercial success is underpinned by our core values of Opportunity, Integrity, Collaboration, and Achievement.

In the past 20 years, we have grown significantly to become a multi-sector institute, delivering a broad range of education and training programs and services in higher education, vocational education and training (VET) and school sectors across ten campuses in Victoria, online, in the workplace and overseas with partner educational and government organisations.

We offer more than 400 courses, from VCE/VCAL/VETiS, through to nationally accredited qualifications such as certificates, diplomas, advanced diplomas, degrees, graduate certificates, graduate diplomas and short courses.

About The Role

Join a dynamic team across 11 sites and growing, teaching newly arrived migrants, refugees and asylum seekers in the South East of Melbourne. Access to professional development and training, including within the Chisholm Professional Educator College. There are opportunities to be involved in curriculum development and other project work in the region and internationally.

These roles are available for daytime, evenings and weekend delivery. As a Casual Teacher you will be accountable for providing professional teaching and learning expertise across all aspects of delivery, planning and performance for English as an Additional Language (EAL).

Your Key Accountabilities Will Be To
  • Plan education practices and delivery sessions that engage learners and meet their needs and learning styles, by using a variety of innovative and adaptive ways including the Institute learning resources as well as blended learning options and mobile technologies
  • Design and develop high quality teaching and learning resources including tailored materials to suit varying learning styles, ensuring they meet all regulatory standards, curriculum requirements and are stored in accordance with Institute policies
  • Implement a continuous improvement approach to the quality of teaching and learning that enables a safe and supportive learning environment for diverse learners and enhances the student experience by improving engagement and encouraging success. Proactively monitor student progress and engage with them to support high levels of participation, and to improve their employability skills and further education opportunities
  • Work collaboratively with other business areas to identify and facilitate further pathway opportunities.
  • Implement the Institute’s Educational Excellence Framework across all teaching and learning practice and ensure compliance with legislation, regulatory standards, government requirements and Institute quality processes and policies
  • Maintain professional development by ensuring educational currency and excellence and actively participating in the development of own annual professional development plan in line with Institute practices and policies
  • Develop commercially focused strategies that contribute to business growth and the achievement of fee for service revenue targets


About You

You will have relevant tertiary qualifications:
  • A 3 year Australian undergraduate degree or equivalent and a post graduate TESOL qualification in Adult Education or equivalent (eg Master of TESOL, Graduate Certificate of TESOL, post graduate Education with a TESOL method, Master of Applied Linguistics with a TESOL major)
  • Registration with relevant professional bodies as required for the teaching discipline.
  • New graduates are encouraged to apply!

Crucial to your success will be a strong understanding of contemporary approaches to education, teaching and learning. You will have the ability to design and deliver up to-date and engaging programs and be able to motivate and guide students to optimise their learning outcomes. You will also have the ability to quickly develop rapport with students and colleagues from a diverse background in a collaborative and innovative environment, as well as have a firm understanding of educational administration tools and practices.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.

OUR COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY

At Chisholm, we embrace differences in gender, age, ethnicity, race, cultural background, disability, religion and sexual orientation. We know that diversity and inclusion helps us to attract, recruit, engage and retain a team of talented people. If you require specific support to apply for this position, please advise the recruiting manager whose contact details are listed in the advertisement. We will work with you to identify the best way to assist you.

Applications Should Include

HOW TO APPLY
  • a covering letter
  • curriculum vitae
  • contact details of three (3) referees

Job description


About Us


Crowe Horwath in Australasia is the largest provider of accounting, audit, tax, business and financial advice to individuals and small and medium enterprises. From a comprehensive network of over 110 offices located in regional, rural and metropolitan areas, we combine local knowledge with world-class technology to help you on your financial journey.

Our vast geographical footprint and team of over 3,000 principals, professionals and support staff provides you access to expertise across the entire range of financial services, ensuring more than just financial advice.

We have affiliations to our global network Crowe Horwath International, which is ranked amongst the top 10 global accounting networks and is known for delivering quality accounting and advisory services in more than 130 countries. We are the relationship that you can count on - large enough to offer a range of expertise and skills - and small enough to provide the personal touch.

Crowe Horwath's areas of expertise include accounting, audit and assurance, tax and business advisory, corporate finance and management consulting. We also specialise in financial advice, superannuation, SMSF and wealth management, general risk and personal insurance, lending and finance.

The Opportunity
Assisting the Principals in the division, this role is responsible for ensuring that all aspects of the team are running smoothly with a strong focus on client delivery and people leadership. This position provides support to develop capability among team members, including delegating and reviewing their work, as well as helping to train, mentor and monitor their performance and productivity.

The focus of this role provides business advisory and accounting advice to a sustainable and profitable portfolio of clients.

Responsibilities include:
  • Produce and review compliance documents, special purpose financial statements, annual financial statements, tax returns and reconciliations for companies, partnerships, trusts and a range of individual businesses;
  • Achieve budgeted chargeable hours, fee targets and profitability of the work for themselves and their team;
  • Maintain up-to-date technical knowledge to ensure compliance with all statutory and relevant regulatory requirements;
  • Manage, coordinate and delegate client work to team members with an appropriate level of capability to ensure team targets are met.


You will continue to service existing client relationships and drive retention by empowering team members to deliver exceptional performance and ensuring jobs are completed effectively by meeting technical standards and deadlines, within budget.

We are looking for candidates who:
  • Have demonstrated leadership experience
  • Possess strong technical abilities
  • Be proactive and deadline-focused
  • Become an integral part of our close-knit team.


This is a great career opportunity for a CA/CPA qualified Business Services Manager with at least 5+ years of relevant experience that enjoys leading and driving a high-performance team.

Benefits


Crowe Horwath provides a professional and friendly working environment, with great culture, benefits and ongoing career development opportunities. This opportunity will motivate you to learn, grow, develop and broaden your knowledge of the industry throughout your career. You will gain exposure across a broad range of financial strategies and professionals, helping build your network and capabilities. Not to mention the below:

  • Modern offices with dual screens, open floor plan and great facilities;
  • Study support including study leave and fee reimbursement for CA or CPA;
  • In house and external training;
  • A range of other corporate benefits.
Interested?

Registered Psychiatric Nurse

Company Name St Vincent’s Health Network Sydney Company Location Fitzroy, AU

New Posted Date Posted 13 hours ago

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Full Time, Part Time and Casual Positions
  • Psychiatric Nurses (RPN2)
  • Mental Health Department
  • Excellent benefits, including salary packaging


About The Mental Health Department

St Vincent's is proud of its International reputation for delivery of Mental Health Services and the use of the 'Strengths Model' and its principles. The Mental Health Service includes a 44 bed adult acute inpatient unit for the cities of Yarra and Boroondara; the Koori state-wide Inpatient Mental Health Service; Continuing Care Teams; a Crisis Assessment Team; ED Mental Health and Psychiatric Triage; Prevention and Recovery Care Service (PARC); Footbridge Community Care Unit; The Primary Intervention Care Team (PICT) and HOPE (suicide prevention); Mobile Support Teams; Clarendon Homeless Outreach Psychiatric Service (CHOPS); Victorian Dual Diagnosis Service (VDDS); Body Image Eating Disorders Treatment and Recovery Service (BETRS) and NEXUS (Concurrent Mental Illness and Substance Use Advisory Service); Consultation & Liaison Service and Victorian Transcultural Mental Health (VTMH) and NEVIL Training Cluster. We work collaboratively with peer workers, consumer and carer-consultants and the Aboriginal Liaison Officer. Everyone receives training in Strengths and support to participate in Productive Ward and Safewards.

Why work in Mental Health at St Vincent's
  • We passionately believe in a recovery approach, based on people's personal strengths
  • We believe that people have the capacity to recover, reclaim and transform their lives
  • We nurture and develop our staff with great opportunities for training and career progression
  • Our work in this field is internationally recognised
  • We believe that the preferred setting for our work is in the community and that the community is an oasis of resources
  • You will join a cohesive, supportive team, committed to the wellbeing of colleagues and consumers
  • Great location, with easy access to public transport and to the city of Melbourne with trams, buses and trains on the doorstop of the hospital and a vibrant, active social scene close by


About The Role

Opportunities currently exist for Psychiatric Nurses (RPN2) to work in Mental Health at St Vincent's. You will provide a high standard of care in accordance with the Strengths model under a recovery oriented framework working closely with the medical and multidisciplinary teams to achieve a positive outcome for all consumers and their families. You will be offered a range of learning opportunities to develop specialist skills and the opportunity to operate as part of an integrated Adult Area Mental Health Service.

Duties
  • Work within the Strengths Model of Recovery Oriented Practice
  • Uphold a culture of hope by using optimistic language supporting consumers and celebrating their recovery efforts
  • Work with consumers to support and sustain existing resources, assets, networks and relationships and to access opportunities, resources and services to achieve their recovery goals
  • Provide education about medication, self-help, coping strategies and symptom management
  • Practice within a recovery framework promoting consumer directed care


Benefits
  • Salary packaging
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Staff Health Centre
  • Staff gym open 24 hours a day


How To Apply

St Vincent's encourages interested applicants to contact us regarding this position; sites visits are welcome prior to interviews. Please contact Brandon Smith on 9231 4673 or Hannah Stephenson on 9231 4403 for further information.

All appointments are made subject to the candidate providing a current satisfactory National Police Certificate conducted by The Victoria Police.

Job description

Mirvac Retail is the market leader in creating value for our customers. We do this by working collaboratively to deliver bold and innovative retail experiences across our portfolio of bespoke urban assets.

We are currently on the lookout for a highly motivated Administration Manager join our busy Centre Management Team at South Village Shopping Centre on a permanent full-time basis.

Reporting to the Centre Manager, the Administration Manager will manage the daily administration of the asset and support the Centre Manager with financial reporting requirements. They will ensure a welcoming and professional first impression is made, with a view to delivering exceptionally memorable and rewarding experiences to our operators, customers, guests and communities

Other responsibilities will include:

  • Contributing to meeting the objectives of the Asset Plan and Business Plan whilst understanding the Asset lifecycle
  • End to end retailer lease administration management
  • Daily and monthly reporting support for the Marketing Manager, Centre Manager & Facilities Management team
  • Ensuring accurate input and currency of information. Including records of public liability insurance and bank guarantees, and 100% accuracy of the tenancy schedule at all times
  • Ensuring all retailer charges are billed, collected and receipted.
  • Ensuring HSE policies, procedures, guidelines, and programs are complied with and HSE legal obligations are met for the Centre
  • Overseeing the general office administration management for the Centre Management office

The ideal candidate will possess:

  • Strong interpersonal skills with a collaborative, professional and empathetic approach to dealing with customers and retailers;
  • Prior experience in a busy administration management based role
  • Strong time management skills, be able to multitask with a strong attention to detail
  • Be proactive and self-motivated and able to work autonomously
  • Have strong written and verbal communication skills
  • High level of IT proficiency e.g. Microsoft Office Package. Proficiency in property accounting software is highly desirable
  • Shopping Centre experience is not mandatory but highly desirable
  • Demonstrated commercial/financial acumen with experience in the preparation and ongoing management of Income and Expenditure Budgets on an accrual basis, and debt collection

If you are interested in being considered for this diverse, rewarding and challenging opportunity within Mirvac please apply with your current resume. For more information on Mirvac please visit our website http://www.mirvac.com/
